009
010package imagingbook.common.image.interpolation;
011
012import imagingbook.common.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
013
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This interface defines the behavior of 2D pixel interpolators
018 * for scalar-valued images. See Ch. 22 of [1] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
022 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 */
027public interface PixelInterpolator {
028        
029        /**
030         * Returns a {@link PixelInterpolator} instance for the specified
031         * {@link InterpolationMethod}.
032         * 
033         * @param method the interpolation method
034         * @return an instance of {@link PixelInterpolator}
035         */
036        public static PixelInterpolator create(InterpolationMethod method) {
037                switch (method) {
038                case NearestNeighbor :  return new NearestNeighborInterpolator();
039                case Bilinear :                 return new BilinearInterpolator();
040                case Bicubic :                  return new BicubicInterpolator(1.00);
041                case BicubicSmooth :    return new BicubicInterpolator(0.25);
042                case BicubicSharp :     return new BicubicInterpolator(1.75);
043                case CatmullRom:                return new CatmullRomInterpolator();
044                case CubicBSpline:              return new CubicBSplineInterpolator();
045                case MitchellNetravali: return new MitchellNetravaliInterpolator();
046                case Lanzcos2 :                 return new LanczosInterpolator(2);
047                case Lanzcos3 :                 return new LanczosInterpolator(3);
048                case Lanzcos4 :                 return new LanczosInterpolator(4);
049                //default : throw new IllegalArgumentException("unhandled interpolation method: " + method);
050                }
051                return null;
052        }
053        
054        /**
055         * Returns the interpolated pixel value for the specified position. 
056         * 
057         * @param ia a {@link ScalarAccessor} to the interpolated image
058         * @param x continuous interpolation position (horiz.)  
059         * @param y continuous interpolation position (vert.)  
060         * @return The interpolated pixel value at position (x,y).
061         */
062        public float getInterpolatedValue(ScalarAccessor ia, double x, double y);
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the value of the one-dimensional weight function w(x), that is
066         * the weight given to some pixel at distance x from the current interpolation
067         * point. This method is primarily used for testing.
068         * 
069         * @param x the position relative to the interpolation point
070         * @return the weight for this position
071         */
072        public double getWeight(double x);
073        
074        /**
075         * Returns the value of the two-dimensional weight function W(x,y), that is
076         * the weight given to some pixel at distance (x,y) relative to the current interpolation
077         * point. This method is primarily used for testing.
078         * 
079         * @param x the x-position relative to the interpolation point
080         * @param y the y-position relative to the interpolation point
081         * @return the weight for this position
082         */
083        public default double getWeight(double x, double y) {
084                return getWeight(x) * getWeight(y);
085        }
086        
087        
088        
089}
